steps.title: Updating a Submodule
steps.description: How to get new changes from a submodule

what_happens_texts: Submodules allow you to include one repository within another while keeping them separate.
When adding a submodule, Git creates a link to a specific commit of the external repository.
The .gitmodules file contains the configuration for all project submodules.
When cloning with --recurse-submodules, Git automatically downloads all submodules.
Updating a submodule fetches new changes and updates the link in the main repository.
important_to_remember_texts: A submodule is a separate Git repository within your project.
A submodule is always linked to a specific commit, not a branch!
Without the .gitmodules file, other developers won't be able to get the submodules.
A regular clone will create empty folders instead of submodules.
After updating a submodule, you need to commit the changes in the main repo.
